description: A 91-year-old Arkansan was killed in a two-vehicle crash in Faulkner County on Thursday morning.
title: 91-year-old Arkansan killed, 2 hurt in 2-vehicle crash
text:
A 91-year-old Arkansan was killed in a two-vehicle crash in Faulkner County on Thursday morning.
Arthur Tapley of Greenbrier was facing north at the intersection of U.S. Highway 64 and Sunny Gap Road at 10:01 a.m., according to Arkansas State Police. As he turned left onto U.S. 64, his 2006 Mercury was hit on its driver's side by a 2005 Chevrolet Tahoe that was driving east on the highway.
Tapley died in the crash while police said the Tahoe's driver and passenger — Seth Jeffrey, 31, of Conway and Nicholas Webster, 22, of Rogers — were injured and taken to Conway Regional Medical Center.
[FATAL WRECKS: Click here for complete coverage of deadly crashes in Arkansas]
Tapley was the 320th death on Arkansas roads this year, according to preliminary data. Police listed the conditions as clear and dry when the wreck happened.
